result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin L. Webster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Webster, Benjamin L.
defendant.address: 4933 Mineral Point Rd., Apt 3, Madison, WI 53705

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 8:39am 
Defendant Benjamin L. Webster not in court.  ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Probation Agent R. Steiner appears by telephone. 
Agent Steiner confirms that only court financial obligations remain due, and that Mr. Webster declined the document that allowed for entry of a civil judgment on the amount due at time of discharge.  Mr. Webster had told him that he wants to appear before the Court regarding the matter. Agent Steiner has been in contact with Mr. Webster in the past days, and Mr. Webster indicated he had arranged transportation to court. 
The Court finds that Mr. Webster has waived any objection by his non-appearance. The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for the court financial amount balance due. 
recess 8:42am.
Probation review hearing on April 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Benjamin L. Webster
Current: 4933 Mineral Point Rd., Apt 3, Madison, WI 53705 United States  (Effective: 03-03-2022)
Prior: 701 Rasback Avenue, Centralia, IL 62801
Routed to JA for further review. 12/5/19--ma

Court's response to 11/21/19 Letter from DOC: I am in trial. It is 6:30pm on 11/21/19. I am forwarding this to Def. Atty. and DA. I am in & out of Court the 22nd & working the 25th. I'll await something from DA/Defense- Stip & order. Otherwise it is simply too late.

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 10:42am.
Defendant Benjamin L. Webster in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance.
Sentencing arguments are given by counsel.
Mr. Weber makes a statement.
__________________
On Counts #1 and #2 each the Court sentences Mr. Webster to 3 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year and 4 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year and 8 months.  These sentences are concurrent to each other, but consecutive to any sentence in being.  
The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 416 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision the same conditions that were previously ordered as conditions of Probation [which are:
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--comply with all Family Court orders regarding Child Support 
--make all child support payments on time
--make all payments and arrearages according to the Child Support orders
--within 5 days of sentencing (or, if confined, within 5 business days of release from custody), defendant shall report to the child support agency, Jefferson County Courthouse, 311 South Center Avenue, Jefferson, Room 219 to complete case management meeting
--advise child support office of any employment or address change within 48 hours of such change
--all payments toward child support and arrearages to be paid through: Wisconsin Support Collection Trust Fund, Box 74200 Milwaukee, WI 53274-0220 NOT through the Department of Corrections
--to pay all statutory court costs]

Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 11:10am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 24, 2019 at 10:30 am.

[MK] case called at 11:06am 
Defendant Benjamin L. Webster not in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin along with Ms. Rue-Miller from the Child Support Agency.
ADA Teuber indicates that the State's hope in requesting this hearing was that Mr. Webster would appear today so that the Court could address with Mr. Webster his minimal payment of the child-support condition of Probation.  ADA Teuber notes that because the payment of child support condition is not a "restitution"-type order, the Court does not have authority to extend Mr. Webster's probation term.  The Probation term was transferred to the State of Illinois where Mr. Webster resides, so the DA's Office or the Child Support Agency may be contacting the Jefferson DOC Office to have them contact the Illinois DOC about either taking action on the concern or else returning the case back to Jefferson County. 
[The Court takes no action. ]
recess 11:08am

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:45am [mo]
Defendant Benjamin L. Webster in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance

Mr.Webster waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited

Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " NO CONTEST " entered on Counts #1 and #2; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State and Joint Recommendation of the Parties, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #3 through #7

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel 

On Counts #1 and #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:
--4 months in the Jefferson County Jail, WITHOUT work release/Huber, to commence FORTHWITH
--to pay $1050.88 in extradiction fees

The Court adopts remainder of conditions of as laid out in criminal case settlement, 

[which are:
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--comply with ALL family court orders regarding Child Support 
--make all child support payments ON TIME
--make all payments and arrearages according to the Child Support orders
--within 5 days of sentencing (or, if confined, within 5 business days of release from custody), defendant shall report to the child support agency, Jefferson County Courthouse, 311 South Center Avenue, Jefferson, Room 219 to complete case management meeting
--advise child support office of any employment or address change within 48 hours of such change
--All payments toward child support and arrearages to be paid through: WISCONSIN SUPPORT COLLECTION TRUST FUND, Box 74200 Milwaukee, WI 53274-0220 NOT through the Department of Corrections
--pay all statutory court costs]


Days credit for time already served:  42  days
recess: 12:25pm

[[Post Hearing: The Clerk inquires of the Court, whether the conditional jail is to be applied to Count #1 or Count #2; the Court directs that the conditional jail is to be applied to Count #1]]

Case called at 1:18pm [mo]
Defendant Benjamin L. Webster appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek(PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Svehlek indicates that Mr. Webster is eligible for SPD representation

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Date of birth and address confirmed on Criminal Complaint 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Bond arguments given by Counsel

The Court requires a $1,000  CASH bond, with conditions:
--update employment and home address with Child Support Agency

Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

recess 1:24 pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/2/2016 at 10:20am  (2) Status Conference on 4/11/2016 at 2:30pm
Out-State Extradition Contact Worksheet with attachments

[MK] case called at 3:30pm
Defendant Benjamin L. Webster not in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall motions for issuance of a Probable Cause Warrant, indicating that Mr. Webster has warrants pending in Jefferson County and Dane County, and that there is a warrant pending for him from Probation & Parole.
The Court finds Probable Cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.  The Court orders issuance of a Probable Cause Warrant- body only; this warrant is extraditable.
recess 3:31pm
